item.title: farhad add a quote by Guy Debord
item.description: "Like lost children we live our unfinished adventures." -- Guy Debord

item.title: farhad add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "Try again. Fail again. Fail better." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: farhad add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "Art has nothing to do with clarity, does not dabble in the clear and does not make clear" -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: farhad add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "Habit is a great deadener." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: farhad add a quote by Guy Debord
item.description: "Young people everywhere have been allowed to choose between love and a garbage disposal unit. Everywhere they have chosen the garbage disposal unit." -- Guy Debord

item.title: farhad add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "We are all born mad. Some remain so." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: farhad add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "You're on Earth. There's no cure for that." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: farhad add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "Dance first. Think later. It's the natural order." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: farhad add a quote by John Cage
item.description: "Every something is an echo of nothing" -- John Cage

item.title: farhad add a quote by John Cage
item.description: "Get yourself out of whatever cage you find yourself in." -- John Cage

item.title: farhad add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: farhad add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I am free and that is why I am lost." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: farhad add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "All language is but a poor translation." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: farhad add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I am a cage, in search of a bird." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: farhad add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "God gives the nuts, but he does not crack them." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: farhad add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Writer speaks a stench." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: farhad add a quote by Julia Kristeva
item.description: "The depressed person is a radical, sullen atheist." -- Julia Kristeva

item.title: farhad add a quote by Giorgio Agamben
item.description: "Remembrance restores possibility to the past, making what happened incomplete and completing what never was. Remembrance is neither what happened nor what did not happen but, rather, their potentialization, their becoming possible once again." -- Giorgio Agamben

item.title: farhad add a quote by Jacques Derrida
item.description: "What cannot be said above all must not be silenced but written." -- Jacques Derrida

item.title: farhad add a quote by Georges Bataille
item.description: "I believe that truth has only one face: that of a violent contradiction." -- Georges Bataille

item.title: farhad add a quote by Georges Bataille
item.description: "The sexual act is in time what the tiger is in space." -- Georges Bataille

item.title: farhad add a quote by Louis-Ferdinand Céline
item.description: "An unfamiliar city is a fine thing. That's the time and place when you can suppose that all the people you meet are nice. It's dream time. " -- Louis-Ferdinand Céline

item.title: farhad add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Kill me, or you are a murderer." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: farhad add a quote by Jacques Ranciere
item.description: "Whoever teaches without emancipating stultifies." -- Jacques Ranciere

item.title: farhad add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "The shock of her death froze something in me. The child I loved, was gone, but I kept looking for her - long after I had left my own childhood behind. The poison was in the wound, you see. And the wound wouldn't heal." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: farhad add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description:
"The dove descending breaks the air With flame of incandescent terror Of which the tongues declare The one discharge from sin and error. The only hope, or else despair Lies in the choice of pyre or pyre- To be redeemed from fire by fire.
Who then devised the torment? Love. Love is the unfamiliar Name Behind the hands that wove The intolerable shirt of flame Which human power cannot remove. We only live, only suspire Consumed by either fire or fire." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: farhad add a quote by Emmanuel Levinas
item.description: "Faith is not a question of the existence or non-existence of God. It is believing that love without reward is valuable." -- Emmanuel Levinas
